main event: A reddish-orange object with pulsating and erratic motion was observed by a driver and her daughter near Monticello, Illinois on July 26, 1960.
interesting points: The object faded out rapidly and disappeared in the original location.
The object was visible for approximately 15 minutes.
The sighting was made from a moving automobile.
Meteorological data and atmospheric conditions were analyzed to try to explain the sighting.
Balloon releases from a nearby location were considered as a possible explanation for the sighting.
sighted object: reddish-orange object with pulsating and erratic motion
